name: Confidence interval
disambiguatingDescription: An estimate of the true value of a statistical measure
description:
The confidence interval is a range of values in which an estimation of the true value of a statistical measure (such as the mean) or a difference between two statistical measures (such as the difference between two means) lies. It is an attempt to move away from the yes/no nature of NHST and statistical testing in general. Corpus linguistics generally uses 95% confidence intervals, i.e. the true value sits within this range for 95% of samples (i.e. corpora) taken from the same population.
In practice, they can be used to compare two or more corpora - if their confidence intervals largely overlap, they were probably taken from the same population. If not, they probably came from different populations
